Authors: Jamjan Meeboon, iman - hidayat, Susumu Takamatsu
Title:
Pseudoidium acalypha-javanicae, a new species of powdery
mildew on Acalypha spp. from Indonesia
Keywords:
Anamorph · Erysiphaceae · Euphorbiaceae · Tropic · rDNA
sequence
Abstract:
Pseudoidium acalypha-javanicae is proposed as a new
species based on analyses of 28S rDNA region and morphological data.
This new species was found on Acalypha wilkesiana var. marginata, A.
argentea, and A. cristata collected from Cibodas Botanical Garden, Bogor
(West Java Province, Indonesia). Our analyses showed that all these
specimens have an identical rDNA sequences and similar morphological
characteristics. They form a distinct clade separated from other species
of Erysiphaceae. Pseudoidium acalypha-javanicae differs from Erysiphe
acalyphae by having shorter conidiophores and foot cells 13 times as
long as the 02 other cells. The conidial size of Pseudoidium
acalypha-javanicae is also smaller than E. jatrophae.
